metadata.Title: CVE-2014-125005 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: A vulnerability, which was classified as problematic, was found in FFmpeg 2.0. This affects the function decode_vol_header of the file libavcodec/mpeg4videodec.c. The manipulation leads to memory corruption. It is possible to initiate the attack remotely. It is recommended to apply a patch to fix this issue.

criterions.comment: ffmpeg: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was not-affected').
